titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the P.M. Suski papers, ca. 1941-1961 LSC.2010.31
titlestmt.subtitle: Japanese American Research Project (JARP) Collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Manuscripts Division staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-24 14:57:26 -0700.

did.unittitle: P.M. Suski papers
did.abstract: Sakae Susuki was born in 1875. A native of Okayama Prefecture, he arrived in the United States in 1898. He graduated from the University of Southern California Medical School in 1917 with additional studies at Berlin University. He lived in San Francisco (1898-1906) but relocated to Los Angeles, California following the Great Earthquake. He was a photographer prior to Medical School and practiced medicine in Southern California before World War II and in Denver post-World War II. He was also known as Dr. Peter M. Suski. The collection consists primarily of manuscripts, clippings, and published versions of works by Sakae Susuki. Includes manuscripts of Issei Viewpoint, a series of short articles published in the English section of the Shin Nichibei (the Japanese American News) (1958-61) as well as clippings of the articles. Also includes clippings of other articles by and about Susuki, and manuscripts for his books, An Introduction to Shosho or the Grass Style of Writing, The Dictionary of Kanji, and Tenbunsh: Jsatsu. Additionally there is a small collection of pre-war photographs. Some materials in this collection are in Japanese.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Japanese.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], P.M. Suski Papers, Japanese American Research Project Collection (Collection 2010). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Sakae Susuki was born in 1875; a native of Okayama Prefecture, he arrived in the United States in 1898; graduated University of Southern California Medical School, 1917; additional studies at Berlin University; lived in San Francisco (1898-1906) and relocated to Los Angeles, California following the Great Earthquake; was a photographer prior to Medical School; practiced medicine in Southern California before World War II and in Denver post-World War II; was also known as Dr. Peter M. Suski; he was also an author and a linguist; died 1961.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists primarily of manuscripts, clippings, and published versions of works by Sakae Susuki. Includes manuscripts of Issei Viewpoint, a series of short articles published in the English section of the Shin Nichibei (the Japanese American News) (1958-61) as well as clippings of the articles. Also includes clippings of other articles by and about Susuki, and manuscripts for his books, An Introduction to Shosho or the Grass Style of Writing, The Dictionary of Kanji, and Tenbunsh: Jsatsu. Additionally there is a small collection of pre-war photographs.
Materials in this collection are in English and Japanese.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Published materials and manuscripts for his books and articles (Boxes 139 and 722).
Manuscripts for his books and articles and newspaper clippings (Box 140).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Japanese American Research Project Collection of Material about Japanese in the United States (Collection 2010) . Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.

did.unittitle: Susuki Papers
Published Materials and Manuscripts

Captain Henry Harkness, M.R.A.S., Ancient and Modern Alphabets of the Popular Hindu Languages, Southern Peninsula of India. London: Published for the Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland by John W. Parker, West Strand, 1837.
Peter M. Suski. "Ancient & Modern Alphabets of the Hindu and Related Languages of India, Tibet, Siam, etc."
A booklet, articles and papers written by Susuki Sakae.
Hints to Students of the Japanese Language. Hollywood, California: W.M. Hawley.
"Beikoku umare Nihonjin-kei jid no taikaku chosa (Dai-ipp)" [characters] ["The body build of American-born Japanese children", Report No. 1], Tokyo Kenbikyo Gakkai Zasshi, vol. 39, no. 1.
"Beikoku umare Nihonjin no taikaku (Daisamp)" [characters] ["The body build of American born Japanese", Report no. 3], Taiiku Kenkyu, vol. 5, nos. 5-6.
"The Body Build of American-Born Japanese Children", Biometrika, vol. XXV, parts III & IV.
Historical Notes on Japan, Denver, Colorado.
Sword Making.
Manuscripts for his books.
Tenbunshu, Jsatsu [characters] [A Collection of Chinese Seal Characters, Volume I].
Partial manuscripts for The Dictionary of Kanji with a chart of phonetic kana.
2 completed manuscripts for An Introduction to shosho or the grass style of writing.
Manuscript for Setsubun ni kansuru kenky [characters] [A study on the Chinese small seal characters].
Manuscripts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: For his books and articles and newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.p: A series of short articles Susuki Sakae published in the English section of the Shin Nichibei [characters] [The Japanese American News] in Los Angeles.

did.unittitle: Clippings of his articles Issei Viewpoint (complete).

scopecontent.p: Also includes a few other articles written by him or about him.
